website_summaries.verdict: With an approximate angle of 17 degrees, this knife is equipped to create a seamless cut of meat, and handles a garlic clove with just as much care.
pros: Heavy enough to secure your grip and equipped to both slice and work on its side to smash and meal your next culinary masterpiece
Versatile enough to create sleek cuts within most food groups
We love the added features that include its ability to maneuver food on its wider side as well
cons: A few customers note the knife takes a while to dry and may rust if extra care is not taken when doing so

customer_reviews.title: Buy this knife!
customer_reviews.text: The best workhorse knife out there! I have bought many for myself and as gifts. Sharpens to a razor on a good whetstone set. There's an adjustment period if you're not used to a vegetable cleaver, but it's well worth it. You'll get a lot done with this knife and after using it regularly for a while your standard French chef knife will feel light, agile, and well controlled in your newly strengthened hand.
customer_reviews.author: Aria.M

customer_reviews.title: A great cheap chinese cleaver
customer_reviews.text: This is the cleaver in countless Chinese households and professional kitchens. You cannot beat the value of the knife. The factory edge is not good but it takes a decent edge if you take the time to sharpen it. The things I didn't like about it is that it is heavy, much heavier than the western chefs knifes that I'm used to. The round handle caused hand cramps for me. Overall it is a great introduction to Chinese Cleavers. Maybe you like it and you stick with it. If you don't like it you know what you don't like and can look for Chinese Cleavers with slightly different styles.
customer_reviews.author: Jong Chen

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend chopping bone but cleaver is great for big load. Straight out of the package is sharp but not super sharp I can sharpen it better. It looked beautiful and everything is well made and put together. Almost didn't buy it because of the review glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Bounphengphongsavath

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose Knife
customer_reviews.text: Cooking for family and friends for over 45 years has taught me one thing.... A good knife is essential for prep. This is my first Asian Chefs knife, I have two other Types. With this knife you can chop, slice, pound, dice and more! This is a Vegetable knife but can be used for chicken bones, if you need a heavier cleaver then I recommend u do your homework online and watch videos on YouTube. You get what you pay for...This is a Great all around knife to add to your Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The knife is god enough but I used a Bamboo Cutting board and chopped a Sweet Potato, three Carrots, and an Onion and the blade has developed a big knick in it. I guess I shouldn't expect much for $14 but still was hoping that at least veggies would cut well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: What a surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't expect this quality and sharpness with this affordable price. The steel quality looks good enough and doesn't look noticeably inferior to my Cutco knifes, which are at least 20 times more expensive. The weight gives the uniqueness and advantage of this type of knife and so far, I am enjoying it. It will need some more time to be accustomed to it and it seems like it will need some taming, too. But again with this price tag, I can't complain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chan Lee

customer_reviews.title: It is unnecessarily heavy and the little plastic ring above the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: This knife is sharp, but that is hardly the only quality you need in a knife. It is unnecessarily heavy and the little plastic ring above the handle stores water inside. I would dry it by hand and when I'd come back the next day, the blade would be stained. The water would trickle down afterwards out of the plastic ring. Didn't take too long for the blade to start rusting. Not buying this brand again. I spent $10 more dollars and bought a ceramic santoku knife. It's not a cleaver, which I wanted, but it won't rust.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: Handle too small, product is cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too small for regular sized hands. Not sure if handle is made of real wood but too slippery. It scraped my finger as I struggled to grip knife while using. Finger covered over the flat top of blade past the handle to press down, resulting in injury the first time I used it to cut meat into cubes (no chopping or bones). The product overall looks and feels cheap, like dollar store variety.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: You dont know what it is made of
customer_reviews.text: It says it is made of the stainless steel but got rusted within a month. Maintained with the rest of 5 other knives so it is definately not stainless, disposible quality.
customer_reviews.author: pallepalle

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a toy. Great tool for anyone that prepares food.
customer_reviews.text: The weight is enough to tell you you have something substantial in your hand. It is not going break too easily. Blade and handle are one piece with wood fashioned on to make it comfortable holding onto. Easy to cut, cleave, rock, and flatten garlic cloves.
customer_reviews.author: nhoj odarroc

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp. At all.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this inexpensive cleaver before investing in a high quality version—forget about it! This cleaver isn’t sharp enough to cut anything safely!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: my new favorite
customer_reviews.text: since it's so big, it's easy to keep in contact with your non cutting hand and practice good knife safety. i really, really love this thing. and it didn't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: review mang

customer_reviews.title: Poor balance, can’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: The steel took a decent edge; was not particularly sharp out of the box. My only problem is the horrible balance. It is very front heavy. The tang is very short which leads to the poor balance. Though cheap, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy it, well built.
customer_reviews.text: My first butcher blade. Has decent weight, feels good in the hand, I just need a bigger chopping board now, lol. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Ken E.

customer_reviews.title: True chinese kitchen knives are single edged
customer_reviews.text: this is a western version of a chinese kitchen knife. real ones are single edged at about 16 degrees. this one is double edged at bout 20 degrees Its good value and could be refined
customer_reviews.author: owen

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife. It isn't unwieldly in the hand and I find that I can cut most objects with ease. The blade itself has enough weight to slice through garlic, tomatoes, and other softer foods without having to exert, if any, downward force. This knife feels good in the hand and can compare to knives five to ten times its cost.
customer_reviews.author: JESSE

customer_reviews.title: JUST AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: THE WINCO CHINESE CLEAVER IS AN EXCELLENT KITCHEN TOOL.I HAVE LEARNED TO RESPECT IT CUTTING POWER.I DON'T USE IT FOR ROUTINE PURPOSES;BUT ONCE I BECOME MORE FAMILIAR WITH ITS FEEL'I WILL USE IT FOR EVERYTHING.IT IS AN AWESOME TOOL AT A MODEST PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a cleaver expert, but this cleaver came very dull. Even using force and the weight of the knife, it was difficult to chop raw root vegetables and cooked pork. Found myself going back to my chef's knife.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: Lovely blade, nicely balanced, sharp as all get out. Tip: let the knife slide forward as you cut, don’t press straight down.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Justice

customer_reviews.title: This is a heavy meat chopper, not a slicer
customer_reviews.text: I got this knife thinking it would be a caidao or vegetable cleaver, but it is thick, heavy, and awkward to use. I’m not sure what this would be good for, but it wasn’t for my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Oy Gevalt

customer_reviews.title: Great knife that works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife that has held up well so far (1 year). Another top rated knife that I purchased on Amazon started rusting after a few days but not this one. This knife gets the job done and works as expected. Cutting thick vegetables or meat is pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: There are much worse games to play

customer_reviews.title: I use this knife to cut the more challenging selection ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife to cut the more challenging selection of meat. It craves right through the meat effortlessly. Exactly what I was expecting. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Very durable product!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. We purchased after seeing a cooking show where the chef talked about how versatile they are and safe when used properly for fine chopping. Makes a lot more sense than trying to chop with carving knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Black liquid leaks
customer_reviews.text: This knife leaks!!! The black liquid thingy will leak from the wooden part of the knife! It ruined everything in the dish washer all the plates became black omg. DONT BUY! Although it's cheap
customer_reviews.author: Riri

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but heavy. Seems to keep a very nice edge.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kelso

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I like the knife cause it is sharp and easy to cut meat but the handle hurt my finger when I hold it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: yang

customer_reviews.title: best knife for the price PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: no need for any more expensive cleaver. amazing and beautiful quality. razor sharp even after hammering through anything. easy for any noob to resharpen as well! i use for everything. and after you chop it can pick it all up to transfer to pan or wherever!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Konecny

customer_reviews.title: Nice Heavy Hand Feel, Cuts Great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It's cheap, but it doesn't feel cheap when you cut stuff with it. I'm not a pro by any means, but this is a great tool for what I need to do in the kitchen at home. Get it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ely

customer_reviews.title: Good cleaver
customer_reviews.text: Its a good inexpensive cleaver. Its not as big as a commercial kitchen cleaver, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chop Chop
customer_reviews.text: This cleaver is pretty much what you'd expect. I use it to chop large quantities of vegetables or hack through bones. The flat front works well for scraping down a butcher block. The handle is short, flimsy and not put together very well, but it doesn't really matter on a knife this inexpensive. I think it was a good value, and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne T. VanWinkle

customer_reviews.title: After you get used to it, it will be your go to knife
customer_reviews.text: Don't be intimidated by the big, sharp, shiny blade. Mash and mince a garlic clove, make prefect onion dice. In spite of the fact that this is not a "meat" cleaver, you can cut raw meat and fish into cubes and cutlets. Just don't try to disjoint a chicken with it. Clean by hand, polish it up and it will stay pretty, and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: WiseWoman

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sharp, ergonomic, great value
customer_reviews.text: I haven't heard of this brand before; I bought it since I wanted a Chinese cleaver (the shape is versatile). This knife turned out great and competes with knives 5x its price. Totally recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Ding

customer_reviews.title: Heavy durable cleaver...
customer_reviews.text: Thicker blade than I really wanted but it should hold up very well. Heavy enough to do about anything you'd want. Note this is "High Carbon" stainless.... if you don't clean it right after use be aware it will stain. (from previous experience) If you clean and dry it right after use it will stay looking like new.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: I like this cleaver very much; It works as expected and looks good. I wash and wipe it after use and it keeps its shine. It is very sharp; I learned that the first day :-) The only thing I suggest is if the manufacturer can create a punch hole in it so people could hang it on the wall. It is too dangerous to sit in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Manucci-Michael Kamali

customer_reviews.title: awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Came in sharp and ready. cut up some veggies and spare ribs with ease to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: william bounsana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, can't believe the price! It is carbon steel so don't leave wet or put in dish washer
customer_reviews.author: Everett DeHart

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Grip and handle isn't very ergo. It's got a sharp blade and cuts very well. If you don't use a cleaver often and just need to have one handy, you can get by with this one. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This original design vegetable knife is lightweight and durable. I have small hands so it's easy for me to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Very sharp.  Good hefty weight.  Slices with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very sharp. Good hefty weight. Slices with ease.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: HI YA - chop chop chop
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp blade and hours of chopping fun using this cleaver. My 13 year old even finds chopping my vegetables more fun with this. It really does the job to finely chop/slice/dice whether it's vegetables or meat. I have had other cleavers and this one so far is my fav.
customer_reviews.author: TexyInAustin

customer_reviews.title: MY GO-TO
customer_reviews.text: I AM A RETIRED CHEF WHO HAD TO PICK THE KNIVES THAT REALLY WOULD WORK FOR THE NEW LIFE OF MINE. THIS KNIFE IS MY GO-TO FOR ANY BIG PROCESSING JOB.
customer_reviews.author: ekorner

customer_reviews.title: It's a Good Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was looking for. Weight is just right, balance is good, and it's very sharp. Just have to be careful not to cut yourself, getting used to it. Makes short work of dicing, slicing and mincing everything from garlic to celery to apples to onions to nuts to-- You get the drift. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: PhotoBug

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is!
customer_reviews.text: it quite a bit heavier than i like and quick to dull on you! go get a kiwi or kom kom knife...youll be way happier!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: CHEF QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This is an authentically crafted cleaver used in the hand of every Chinese Chef. Ive owned several of these and at the end of the night the best joy I get from a long days of hard work is sharpening my steel. Very effient product. 6⭐
customer_reviews.author: John Mai

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting bagels
customer_reviews.text: I use it for cutting bagels. Works great. Impressed and quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money....can't beat it!!
customer_reviews.text: Smart buy for budget cleaver. Very sharp and of good quality. This will last!
customer_reviews.author: gregory s burris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: Used it at work for a day (Chinese banquet restaurant) and the edge stayed sharp the whole time. It's also very nice to look at; simple but elegant design. It's a little heavier than I thought it would, but it's still easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: So cheaply made...
customer_reviews.text: ... water collects in the handle and drips out if you don't let it dry blade facing down.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Good all purpose cleaver
customer_reviews.text: This knife is well made, very nicely balanced and has a good weight. It is ideal for chopping vegetables (slices through a head of cabbage with ease!) as well as meat. The price was also right!
customer_reviews.author: Knight Telekinetic

customer_reviews.title: and even used this bad boy to split an entire frozen chicken in half
customer_reviews.text: I have only had to sharpen/hone this blade once, thanks to the comments for pointing out to sharpen it. I've cut through a lot of chicken, vegetables, and even used this bad boy to split an entire frozen chicken in half. Needless to say, this knife is now my pride and joy in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gilbert-Uhlman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price what I paid was unbeatable. It needed to be sharpen right out of the box though. We consume coconut and watermelons occasionally and this is the best choice we could get.
customer_reviews.author: AncientMan

customer_reviews.title: Sliced through paper with ease!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good knife for the price. I wanted to see how sharp it was so I took a piece of paper & sliced it. It's pretty sharp out of the box. For less than $10, it's a good deal. I gave it 4 stars because I don't like the design of the handle. I'm just being picky.
customer_reviews.author: B. Codner

customer_reviews.title: Great Value & Product 性价比高 很好用
customer_reviews.text: This cleaver is sharp and of great quality. I used it everyday for a month and it works perfectly. 这菜刀很好用
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, quality, function, value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, weight, and balance make work effortless and enjoyable. It does the job by itself, just let it dance. Design, and proportions are beautiful. Materials are chosen without compromise. It has every bit of traditional charm. It provides first-hand experience of amazing Chinese culture. It is made with contamporary and traditional materials, and manufactured rock-solid. This makes it functionally better than the original, as much at a craftsman can perfect the perfection. If you appreciate the amazing experience of Chinese food and cooking, this knife is a must-have gift you owe to yourself.
customer_reviews.author: aebteacher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife, not super sharp but it doesnt have to be. Heavy weight makes cutting a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Will H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this cleaver. It is very sharp and has good heft. I live in a dryer climate so don't have any problem with rusting. I simply make a point to wash and dry it right away after using.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming Eagle

customer_reviews.title: A very budget friendly cleaver.
customer_reviews.text: Cleaver has great heft. Arrived with a good edge. I'll have to see how long it holds, though. Processed vegetables very quickly. All in all a good buy so far for the price.
customer_reviews.author: El Tejon

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly heavy duty! Hand wash only and immediately after use to keep it in good condition
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Quality is amazing, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with it. For a little money You get a lot of knife. Quality is amazing,very sharp,high carbon steel (needs to be taken care of cleaning wise-not an issue for me) I am getting more and more surprised of how Chinese products are getting so better. Buying another one,just cannot afford to have one extra for almost free. Limited use(veggies or soft food only) But for the money...Just trow it away and buy another one if You damaged it badly:)
customer_reviews.author: valero9973

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great weight. I had to sharpen which was easy. Use them to cut fajitas and other meats.
customer_reviews.author: scott ary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Price
customer_reviews.text: Taking into account other reviews, I am using this blade purely for vegetables and am avoiding bones and frozen foods to keep the sharpness of the blade intact. Weight is great and comes shipped very well sharpened. For how much I paid it is an excellent knife that will help in the kitchen for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Knife worked great, I love that it also works great as a bench scraper after you are done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tomcsanyi

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. He loved trying it out and said the weight was perfect for he wants to do.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bumgardner

customer_reviews.title: Great Veggie chopper
customer_reviews.text: This Winco cleaver is an easy to use and excellent vegetable chopper.It is also easy to transfer chopped veggies to other containers with such a wide blade.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It's as described; I won't be using it often, but when I need it I'll be glad I have it. I wouldn't have wanted to invest big bucks.
customer_reviews.author: telegrem

customer_reviews.title: Knife
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sharp. Purchased 6 for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: RJAY

customer_reviews.title: Good kitchen tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This keeps an edge longer than I thought it would because of the price. The way you can chop and then use it like a vegetable dust pan into the pot......awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Netharlan

customer_reviews.title: Winco Chinese Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: I like that it makes it easier to chop veggies for making salad. I make big salads and cutting carrots thinly was worth getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Gelly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and durable cleaver.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and durable cleaver. Holds it edge well and extremely sharp after a bit of work on the whet stone
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit heavy compared to previous Chinese cleavers I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Racela

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Quality sharp tool for chopping- fits the hand perfectly. My wife is Chinese and she absolutely loves this, saying it's very well made and designed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Chinese-style Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: This cleaver is fantatsic, and the price cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Randell R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! it's sharp in the beginning few months lol
customer_reviews.author: Tsasaa

customer_reviews.title: So far has been a great knife! These are my personal favorite types of ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as it seemed to be. So far has been a great knife! These are my personal favorite types of knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The knife is not as thin as the pic shows. It's medium thick. Excellent knife
customer_reviews.text: The knife is not as thin as the pic shows. It's medium thick and a little heavy. Excellent knife and easy to cut ribs
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: need to teach him how much better a sharp knife is than a dull one
customer_reviews.text: Cecil loves it and hasn't even cut himself yet, need to teach him how much better a sharp knife is than a dull one!
customer_reviews.author: David Squier

customer_reviews.title: very sharp and handy
customer_reviews.text: it's good. how do i finish this review. there are 10 more words required. now 5 more. now 3 more....
customer_reviews.author: dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Ma-ma hu-hu
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about an 11 dollar cleaver too much. The blade is thicker than I'd like, but not thick enough to chop bones. Balance feels off. I wouldn't be able to race through a bunch of minced garlic, but maybe it would be OK for slicing meat or carrots. I miss my old super-cheap thin carbon steel cleaver. I'll figure out something to do with it and like I said how can you complain about a $11 knife?
customer_reviews.author: S. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough knife for the price I guess
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough knife for the price I guess. Blade is a little too thick in places and this sometimes disrupts the smooth slicing action.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think I might fare better with a 7" blade
customer_reviews.text: I think I might fare better with a 7" blade, so currently this knife is way too heavy for me - It tires out my hand just using it for 10 minutes. But other than that, this is an awesome all-purpose knife. Chopping up veggies and small meats are a breeze. I wouldn't say it's great for slicing, but it does the job reasonably well. I'd recommend buying this as a starter - just to dip your toes in the waters of Chinese Knifes. For that alone, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sotto

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife! I have been wanting a Chinese cleaver for a long time, but didn't want to spend too much. This is a great knife for the price, but also just a great knife in general. Do yourself a favor and buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use, especially when you cut bones.
customer_reviews.author: Wentao Wang

customer_reviews.title: Best Knife
customer_reviews.text: The title says it best. I use it as an all around kitchen tool. This is my second Chinese Cleaver
customer_reviews.author: SZ Petty

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp right out of the box. Well made Sturdy Easy to resharpen Good high carbon steel Keep it oiled with olive oil to prevent rust Look out Ming.....I am comming for you BAM
customer_reviews.author: Dan long

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Sharp on top but after sanding down I was able to put pressure with my palm on the top edge of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Flores

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: traditional chinese vleaver, good product. very sharp, a little heavy , but that's what I need. Most importantly, the price is OK.
customer_reviews.author: XA

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I used in China
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain. My mom uses this kind of knife when cooking, so do I. I might try other kinds of knives but I chose this as my first knife without any doubt.
customer_reviews.author: zhoudingfang

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The handle feels very flimsy, not sure how long this will last, but the blade is high carbon stainless steel which is good. I do not like the winco stamp on the corner of one side, but hope that this will wear off with time. For the price, it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kaya

customer_reviews.title: im a head chef in a chinese restaurant
customer_reviews.text: This knife blew the knives my boss has out of the water im head cook at a local restaurant and i use my knive for practically everything love it
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Gail Platz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome vegetable style cleaver but works great on meat as well. I have babied it and sharpened it up a bit and it is razor sharp man! Always gets compliments as well. I do recommend sharpening it even though it came pretty sharp already
customer_reviews.author: C-Rad

customer_reviews.title: New kitchen favorite but not as tough as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The weight and balance is perfect for chopping and slicing veggies; it's quickly become my favorite in prepping food. However, nobody told me that it wouldn't make a good cleaver, and I chipped it just a little bit trying to hack a pork shoulder. Maybe that was my fault and ignorance, but I definitely won't be doing that again.
customer_reviews.author: wpg

customer_reviews.title: dull & knicked blade
customer_reviews.text: - Better off going to Chinatown to get. This product's blade had a knick in it or something in it; uneven blade. + Shipped timely
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cleaver for use in cooking and was very pleased with the purchase. Thanks a lot. I am very pleased with the acquisition. It was very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: WINCO BLADE CHINESE CLEAVER
customer_reviews.text: .THE CHOPPER IS ALL THAT I HAD HOPED FOR.THE PRICE WAS EXCELLENT. THE CHOPPER ITSELF APPEARS TO BE OF GOOD QUALITY...A GREAT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Crockford

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: The blade is very sharp and serves the purpose. Quality is good, looks durable. I got another one for my mom. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quite sharp, as long as you remember this is a vegetable knife. It should not be used for bone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The price dropped 3 bucks after the first I got it. But it is still a good one. looks just like the first photo.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great Hacker, Bad Slicer
customer_reviews.text: For me, the blade was too thick, making it hard to slice through an onion, for example. Probably pretty good for hacking a chicken, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: I've owned several knives like this and this is the best so far
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several knives like this and this is the best so far. A little light for butchering a chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy not so good quality blade. The good news is that it is heavy enough to become a meat cleaver (for chicken, maybe not for big bones) For a few more dollars you can get much better so I don't quite see the point of going so unexpensive
customer_reviews.author: ls
